Uses of Class
streamql.query.Q

  • Packages that use Q 
    Package Description
    streamql  

    • Uses of Q in streamql

      Methods in streamql that return Q 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static <A,B> Q<A,B> QL.aggr(B init, utils.lambda.Func2<B,A,B> update)
      Given an initial value to the aggregate, the aggr construct aggregates the input item and produces the aggregating results every time the aggregate is updated.
      static <A,B,C> Q<A,C> QL.aggr(B init, utils.lambda.Func2<B,A,B> update, utils.lambda.Func1<B,C> out)
      Given an initial value to the aggregate, the aggr construct aggregates the input items, applies an output function to the aggregate, and sends out the result (i.e., output from the output function) every time the aggregate is updated.
      static <A> Q<A,A> QL.aggr(utils.lambda.Func2<A,A,A> update)
      The aggr construct aggregates the input item and produces the aggregating result every time the aggregate is updated.
      static <A,B,C> Q<A,C> QL.aggr(java.util.function.Supplier<B> init, utils.lambda.Act2<B,A> update, utils.lambda.Func1<B,C> out)
      Given an initial value of the aggregate from a supplier as a mutable data structure, the aggr construct aggregates the input item, applies an output function to the aggregate, and sends out the result (i.e., output from the output function) every time the aggregate is updated.
      static <A,B> Q<A,B> QL.aggrGetInit(utils.lambda.Func1<A,B> getInit, utils.lambda.Func2<B,A,B> update)
      Given an initial value of the aggregate by applying a mapping function to the first input item, the aggr construct aggregates the input item and produces the aggregating result every time the aggregate is updated.
      static <A,B,V> Q<A,B> QL.annotate(Q<A,V> query, utils.lambda.Func2<A,V,B> func)
      The annotate construct processes the input stream by a query and annotates the output of this query to the input item using a binary function.
      static Q<java.lang.Double,java.lang.Double> QL.averageDouble()
      The averageDouble construct computes the average of the input doubles.
      static Q<java.lang.Float,java.lang.Double> QL.averageFloat()
      The averageFloat construct computes the average of the input floats.
      static Q<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Double> QL.averageInt()
      The averageInt construct computes the average of the input integers.
      static Q<java.lang.Long,java.lang.Double> QL.averageLong()
      The averageLong construct computes the average of the input long integers.
      static <A> Q<A,java.lang.Integer> QL.count()
      The count construct counts the number of the input items and outputs the result as an integer.
      static <A> Q<A,java.lang.Long> QL.countLong()
      The countLong construct counts the number of the input items and outputs the result as an long integer.
      static <A> Q<A,A> QL.distinct()
      The distinct construct echoes the input stream with the removal of duplicated data items.
      static <A> Q<A,java.lang.Integer> QL.distinctCount()
      The distinctCount construct counts the number of the distinct input items and outputs the result as an integer.
      static <A> Q<A,java.lang.Long> QL.distinctCountLong()
      The distinctCountLong construct counts the number of the distinct input items and outputs the result as a long integer.
      static <A> Q<A,A> QL.duplicate(int num)
      For an integer num that is larger than 0, the duplicate construct echos the duplication of each input item for num times.
      static <A,B> Q<A,B> QL.emit(java.util.Iterator<B> items)
      The emit construct emits elements contained in items before the arrival of the first input item and halts immediately.
      static <A,B,C,K> Q<utils.structures.Timed<utils.structures.Or<A,B>>,utils.structures.Timed<C>> QL.equiJoin(utils.lambda.Func1<A,K> getKey1, utils.lambda.Func1<B,K> getKey2, utils.lambda.Func2<A,B,C> combine)
      For each time unit, the equiJoin construct joins input items from two categories using a binary function, where these input items share the same key (specified by getKey1 and getKey2), and they are valid in the current time unit.
      static Q<java.lang.Double,utils.structures.Complex> QL.FFT(int wndSize, int bufferSize)
      The FFT construct performs Fast Fourier Transformation on the input stream, where wndSize is the size of the tumbling Window, and bufferSize is the size of the FFT buffer, which should be a power of 2.
      static Q<java.lang.Double,utils.structures.Complex> QL.FFT(int wndSize, int bufferSize, utils.algorithms.FFT.MaskWindow mask)
      The FFT construct performs Fast Fourier Transformation on the input stream, where wndSize is the size of the tumbling Window, and bufferSize is the size of the FFT buffer, which should be a power of 2.
      static <A> Q<A,A> QL.filter(java.util.function.Predicate<A> predicate)
      The filter construct selects the input elements by a predicate.
      static <A,B> Q<A,B> QL.filterMap(java.util.function.Predicate<A> predicate, utils.lambda.Func1<A,B> func)
      The filterMap construct first applies a filter query to the input stream and then applies a map query to the output of the filter query, which is a syntactical sugar for pipeline(filter, map).
      static Q<java.lang.Double,java.lang.Double> QL.FIR(double[] coefficients)
      The FIR construct performs finite impulse response (FIR) filtering on the input stream, where coefficients is an array that stores the FIR coefficients.
      static Q<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Integer> QL.FIR(int[] coefficients)
      The FIR construct performs finite impulse response (FIR) filtering on the input stream, where coefficients is an array that stores the FIR coefficients.
      static <A> Q<java.util.Iterator<A>,A> QL.flatten()
      The flatten construct echoes every element contained in the input item (Iterator) to the output.
      static <A,B,K> Q<A,B> QL.groupBy(utils.lambda.Func1<A,K> getKey, Q<A,B> query)
      The groupBy (key-partitioning) construct partitions the input stream by a key, obtained by the function getKey, and applies query to each partitioned sub-stream.
      static <A,B,C,K> Q<A,C> QL.groupBy(utils.lambda.Func1<A,K> getKey, Q<A,B> query, utils.lambda.Func2<K,B,C> combine)
      The groupBy (key-partitioning) construct partitions the input stream by a key, obtained by the function getKey, and applies query to each partitioned sub-stream.
      static <A,B,K> Q<A,B> QL.groupByAggr(utils.lambda.Func1<A,K> getKey, B init, utils.lambda.Func2<B,A,B> update)
      The groupByAggr construct partitions the input stream by a key, obtained by the function getKey and aggregates the items for every sub-stream (running aggregation).
      static <A,B,K> Q<A,B> QL.groupByReduce(utils.lambda.Func1<A,K> getKey, B init, utils.lambda.Func2<B,A,B> update)
      The groupByReduce construct partitions the input stream by a key, obtained by the function getKey and aggregates the items for every sub-stream (reducing aggregation).
      static <A> Q<A,A> QL.ignore()
      The ignore construct ignores the input items and halts when the input stream terminates.
      static <A> Q<A,A> QL.ignore(int num)
      Given an integer num that is larger than 0, the ignore construct ignores the first num input items and halts immediately.
      static Q<java.lang.Double,java.lang.Double> QL.IIR(double[] feedbackCoef, double[] forwardCoef)
      The IIR construct performs infinite impulse response (IIR) filtering on the input stream, where feedbackCoef and forwardCoef are arrays that store the feedback and feedforward coefficients.
      static <A,B> Q<A,B> QL.iterate(Q<A,B> query)
      The temporal iteration construct repeats a query indefinitely -- whenever this query halts, this construct restarts it and applies it to the rest of the stream.
      static <A,B,C> Q<utils.structures.Timed<utils.structures.Or<A,B>>,utils.structures.Timed<C>> QL.join(utils.lambda.Func2<A,B,C> combine)
      For each time unit, the join construct joins input items from two categories that are valid in the current time unit using a binary function.
      static <A,B> Q<A,B> QL.map(utils.lambda.Func1<A,B> func)
      The map construct applies a mapping function to each input item and outputs the result.
      static <A extends java.lang.Comparable>
      Q<A,A>      		 QL.max()
      The max construct outputs the item from the input stream that has the maximum value.

      static <A,B> Q<A,B> QL.parallel(Q<A,B> f1, Q<A,B> f2)
      The parallel construct executes multiple queries in parallel on the same input stream and merge their results (specifically, interleaved).
      static <A,B> Q<A,B> QL.parallel(Q<A,B> f1, Q<A,B> f2, Q<A,B> f3)
      The parallel construct executes multiple queries in parallel on the same input stream and merge their results (specifically, interleaved).
      static <A,B,C> Q<A,C> QL.pipeline(Q<A,B> f1, Q<B,C> f2)
      This is a 2-stage streaming pipeline, where the output of f1 is sent to the input of f2.

      static <A> Q<A,A> QL.search(java.util.function.Predicate<A> predicate)
      The search construct searches for the occurrence of the first input item that satisfies predicate.

      The search construct sends its input stream to query.
      static <A,B> Q<A,B> QL.seq(Q<A,B> f1, Q<A,B> f2)
      The temporal sequencing construct performs queries f1 and f2 on the input stream one after the other -- to begin with, f1 processes the input stream, after it halts, f2 gets initialized and processes the rest of the stream.
      static <A,B> Q<A,B> QL.seq(Q<A,B> f1, Q<A,B> f2, Q<A,B> f3)
      The temporal sequencing construct performs queries on the input stream one after the other.

      The temporal sequencing construct performs queries on the input stream one after the other.

      The temporal sequencing construct performs queries on the input stream one after the other.
      static <A> Q<A,A> QL.skip(int num)
      Given an integer num that is larger than 0, the skip construct skips the first num input items and echoes the rest of the stream.
      static <A> Q<A,A> QL.skipUntil(java.util.function.Predicate<A> predicate)
      The skipUntil construct skips the input items until the first input item satisfies predicate, and it echoes the rest of the stream.

      static Q<java.lang.Double,utils.structures.Complex> QL.STFT(int wndSize, int slidingInterval, int bufferSize)
      The STFT construct performs Short Time Fourier transformation on the input stream, where wndSize is the size of the window, slidingInterval is the sliding interval of STFT, and bufferSize is the size of the FFT buffer, which should be a power of 2.

      The STFT construct performs Short Time Fourier transformation on the input stream, where wndSize is the size of the window, slidingInterval is the sliding interval of STFT, and bufferSize is the size of the FFT buffer, which should be a power of 2.

      The STFT construct performs fast Short Time Fourier transformation on the input stream, where wndSize is the size of the window, slidingInterval is the sliding interval of STFT, and bufferSize is the size of the FFT buffer, which should be a power of 2.

      static <A,B> Q<A,B> QL.sWindow(int wndSize, int interval, Q<A,B> subQuery)
      The sliding window construct applies subQuery to windows of size wndSize with a new window starting every interval items.
      static <A,B> Q<A,B> QL.sWindow10(utils.lambda.Func10<A,A,A,A,A,A,A,A,A,A,B> func)
      Given a function func that reduces 10 input items to an output item, sWindow10(func) applies this function to every 10 continuous input items, i.e., sliding-window (move-by-1) aggregation.
      static <A,B> Q<A,B> QL.sWindow2(utils.lambda.Func2<A,A,B> func)
      Given a function func that reduces 2 input items to an output item, sWindow2(func) applies this function to every 2 continuous input items, i.e., sliding-window (move-by-1) aggregation.

      Given a function func that reduces 3 input items to an output item, sWindow3(func) applies this function to every 3 continuous input items, i.e., sliding-window (move-by-1) aggregation.

      The sWndReduce construct splits the input stream into sliding windows and aggregates each window by a binary function.
      static <A> Q<A,A> QL.sWndReduce(int wndSize, int interval, utils.lambda.Func2<A,A,A> update)
      The sWndReduce construct splits the input stream into sliding windows and aggregates each window by a binary function, where the initial value of the aggregation is the value of the first item in each window.
      static <A,B> Q<A,B> QL.sWndReduceI(int wndSize, int interval, B init, utils.lambda.Func2<B,A,B> add, utils.lambda.Func2<B,A,B> remove)

      Given an integer num that is larger than 0, the take construct echoes the first num input items and halts.

      static <A> Q<A,A> QL.takeUntil(java.util.function.Predicate<A> predicate)
      Given a predicate, the takeUntil construct echoes the input items until the first time the input item satisfies the predicate, and it immediately halts.
      static <A,B> Q<A,B> QL.takeUntil(Q<A,B> query, java.util.function.Predicate<B> predicate)
      Given a predicate, the takeUntil construct sends its input stream to query.
      static <A> Q<A,A> QL.takeWhen(java.util.function.Predicate<A> startPred, java.util.function.Predicate<A> endPred)
      The takeWhen construct skips the input items until the input item satisfies startPred, and it takes the rest of the stream until the input item satisfies endPred.
      static <A,B> Q<A,B> QL.takeWhen(Q<A,B> query, java.util.function.Predicate<B> startPred, java.util.function.Predicate<B> endPred)
      The takeWhen construct sends its input stream to query.
      static <A,B> Q<A,B> QL.tWindow(int wndSize, Q<A,B> subQuery)
      The tumbling window construct partitions the input stream into non-overlapping regions with a fixed length (i.e., #wndSize of items) and applies subQuery to items in each window.
      static <A,B> Q<A,B> QL.tWindow2(utils.lambda.Func2<A,A,B> func)
      Given a function func that reduces 2 input items to an output item, tWindow2(func) applies this function to tumbling windows of size 2.

      Given a function func that reduces 3 input items to an output item, tWindow3(func) applies this function to tumbling windows of size 3.

      The tWndReduce construct splits the input stream into tumbling windows and aggregates each window by a binary function.
      static <A> Q<A,A> QL.tWndReduce(int wndSize, utils.lambda.Func2<A,A,A> update)
      The tWndReduce construct splits the input stream into tumbling windows and aggregates each window by a binary function, where the initial value of the aggregation is the value of the first item in each window.
      static <A,S,B> Q<A,B> QL.udf(java.util.Iterator<B> startItems, S init, utils.lambda.Func2<S,A,S> updateNext, utils.lambda.Func1<S,B> outNext, utils.lambda.Func1<S,S> updateEnd, utils.lambda.Func1<S,B> outEnd, java.util.Iterator<B> endItems)

      static <A,B,C> Q<utils.structures.Or<A,B>,C> QL.zip(utils.lambda.Func2<A,B,C> combine)
      The zip construct combines input items from two categories one-by-one using a binary function.

      The zipLast construct combines the last input item from two categories using a binary function.

      static <A,B,C,K> Q<A,C> QL.groupBy(utils.lambda.Func1<A,K> getKey, Q<A,B> query, utils.lambda.Func2<K,B,C> combine)
      The groupBy (key-partitioning) construct partitions the input stream by a key, obtained by the function getKey, and applies query to each partitioned sub-stream.
      static <A,B> Q<A,B> QL.iterate(Q<A,B> query)
      The temporal iteration construct repeats a query indefinitely -- whenever this query halts, this construct restarts it and applies it to the rest of the stream.
      static <A,B> Q<A,B> QL.parallel(Q<A,B> f1, Q<A,B> f2)
      The parallel construct executes multiple queries in parallel on the same input stream and merge their results (specifically, interleaved).

      static <A,B> Q<A,B> QL.seq(Q<A,B> f1, Q<A,B> f2)
      The temporal sequencing construct performs queries f1 and f2 on the input stream one after the other -- to begin with, f1 processes the input stream, after it halts, f2 gets initialized and processes the rest of the stream.

      static <A,B> Q<A,B> QL.sWindow(int wndSize, int interval, Q<A,B> subQuery)
      The sliding window construct applies subQuery to windows of size wndSize with a new window starting every interval items.
      static <A,B> Q<A,B> QL.take(Q<A,B> query, int num)
      Given an integer num that is larger than 0, the take construct sends its input stream to query.

      The takeWhen construct sends its input stream to query.
      static <A,B> Q<A,B> QL.tWindow(int wndSize, Q<A,B> subQuery)
      The tumbling window construct partitions the input stream into non-overlapping regions with a fixed length (i.e., #wndSize of items) and applies subQuery to items in each window.
